Project_Description: The DIRECTV addressable advertising platform was launched in 2012, providing our TV advertisers a new and more targeted way to reach viewers. The Addressable Advertising Platform serves both national advertisers with Aggregation and Local Advertisers with Zone Targeted Advertising (“ZTA”). The addressable universe is roughly 13M homes served with both HD and SD DVR’s including the Genie server. • Differentiate DIRECTV Ad Sales to make our platform a must buy • Adopt a data driven approach to provide advertisers with more insights and accountability • Improve the customer experience (Advertisers & Agencies) by making our platform easier to buy, manage and operate. As Addressable campaigns have been executed certain aspects of the Addressable Platform need enhancements to scale the business, resolve certain Advertising Customer and Advertising partner issues. This PRD will establish the most critical asks for 2014. Eventually the Addressable Platform capability should be extended to all advertising product lines, Dynamic Ad Insertion (“DAI”) in DTVEverywhere and DAI for Set Top Box VOD. The Platform will be enriched by other Entertainment based projects such as Genie recommendations, Universal profiles and cross platform recommendations.

Improve the scalability, flexibility and stability of the Addressable workflow by providing enhancements, including: a faster way to enable Attributes, enabling the Addressable targeting of Guide Banners, and expanding the attribute capacity.

The DIRECTV iTV Advertising platform was launched in 2004 to provide TV advertisers with a new way to reach and engage their audience. Few updates have been made since then and DIRECTV is losing ad share (Previous clients such as AXE, Hyundai, Red Bull) to MVPD’s and emerging players (i.e. XBOX ad sales growth was 140% year ’11 to ‘12) that provide competitive iTV advertising solutions. Furthermore, there is ever increasing interest in 2 way connectivity to the STB, which enhances advertiser’s ability to effectively target and report on advertising. iTV advertising is advancing by leaps and bounds and advertisers want to be a part of that. HD Video and graphics, broadband delivered features, connected TV apps, multiple On-Demand features, branded experiences utilizing HTML5 and second screen experiences are all advances in the marketplace that our clients are asking for.

The HD Isilon storage block contains content assets used for HD linear playout via iTX automation. These assets include live events, ad sales, PPV, and Audience network programs. The life cycle of these assets are not controlled by any content management automation, leaving Operations to manually purge these assets on a periodic basis. This project will address this risky, inefficient, and labor-intensive content handling model by creating an application layer, combined with business rules, to manage content life cycles by type. (CAPEX: 15.164.00)

This capability delivers on the DTVE core strategy of bringing more content to more devices and helps mitigate erosion of DIRECTV services to alternative IP based services (i.e. Netflix, Hulu+, etc.). This functionality will also reinforce DIRECTV as the entertainment hub and provide a competitive advantage over other MVPD’s. Schedule updates are completed periodically throughout the day. Due to this functionality, last minute schedule updates or one-off corrections are limited and require brute force update functionality. TMS is planning to provide “within minutes” schedule updates and other potential sources of updates (e.g. sports program monitoring, Internet information). Using the new sources of data provided by TMS, a complimentary system will be developed to support these real-time schedule updates. The purpose of this enhancement is to ensure that live events are not cut-off, thus improving the user experience.

ProjectName: Restart and Lookback C3 for Mobile and Dotcom
Project_Description: This project will leverage real-time-encoding (RTE) to 1) allow customers to restart rights-permitting programs on Live Streaming channels when tuning into the program after it has already started, and 2) make rights-permitting programs available as VOD content after the program has aired for the duration of the C3 window. “Restart” is the branded name of the Live Streaming “Start Over” service. “Look Back” is an internal name only for the C3 VOD service, formally referred to as “72 Hour Look Back”. This service will not be branded for customers, and Look Back titles will appear as VOD titles with no special “Look Back” or “C3” visual distinction. Restart and Look Back programs on phones, tables and dotcom will retain Nielsen and comScore tagging.

Project_Description: Upgrades to Traffic systems software are required to increase speed, efficiency and accurateness for Sports Programming and PPV Scheduling. The upgrades will create a Sports Programming portal and database to allow critical information (i.e. sports schedules) to flow directly from the sports programmers, automate PPV movie scheduling and upgrade the PAD (Program Associated Data) creation system.

We are proposing a hardware refresh (performed by Sencore) where the PC platform is upgraded to current hardware (Motherboard, CPU, RAM and power supply) and OS upgraded to Windows Server 2008 while re-using much of the Sencore specific hardware. This should add at least 3-years’ worth of life to this already established troubleshooting tool. (CAPEX: 15.144.00)

Project_Description: Phase 1 (completion planned in late 2013) is in progress. This phase addresses the replacement for the ATPS in MPEG4. Phase 2 addresses the replacement for TPS (MPEG2). Objective is to field test the new UTPS system, commission and deploy the UTPS at 4 uplink facilities, and transition legacy CONUS and Local channels to UTPS.
